title: Letters to Barron’s
text:
The Opioid Crisis

To the Editor:

When someone irresponsibly drinks alcohol, gets behind the wheel of a car, and creates a fatal accident, we don’t sue the car manufacturer or the distillery (“The Opioid Reckoning,” Cover Story, Sept. 20). Federal law protects firearms manufacturers and dealers from being sued when their weapons are used in the commission of a crime. Yet, somehow, we view lawsuits that would obliterate the bank accounts of drug companies that legally produced opioids under the auspices of the Food and Drug Administration...
description: Readers sound off on the opioid crisis, Leon Cooperman, and Vanguard’s PS&G securities
